createTable.remarks: Records the history and progress of v1 -> v2 workspace migration attempts

column.name: WORKSPACE_ID
column.remarks: ID of the WORKSPACE being migrated.

column.name: CREATED
column.remarks: When the system scheduled migrating the WORKSPACE.

column.name: STARTED
column.remarks: When the system started migrating the WORKSPACE.

column.name: FINISHED
column.remarks: When the system finished migrating the WORKSPACE.

column.name: OUTCOME
column.remarks: The state of migrating the WORKSPACE when the system FINISHED.

column.name: MESSAGE
column.remarks: Any supplemental message generated by the system, including failure messages.

changeSet.author: ehigham
changeSet.comment: The task of migrating a v1 workspace to a v2 workspace might fail for a number of reasons and it's important that we record these failures. An attempt at migrating any particular workspace is represented by an insertion into V1_WORKSPACE_MIGRATION_HISTORY. To prevent concurrent attempts, we'll only allow insertions when previous attempts have FINISHED.
changeSet.sql: CREATE TRIGGER fail_insert_if_workspace_is_being_migrated BEFORE INSERT ON V1_WORKSPACE_MIGRATION_HISTORY FOR EACH ROW BEGIN IF (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM V1_WORKSPACE_MIGRATION_HISTORY h WHERE h.WORKSPACE_ID = NEW.WORKSPACE_ID AND h.FINISHED IS NULL) THEN SET @error_message = CONCAT_WS(' ', 'Workspace', NEW.WORKSPACE_ID, 'is already being migrated.'); SIGNAL SQLSTATE '45000' SET MESSAGE_TEXT = @error_message; END IF; END ~
